description: {"blocks":[{"key":"6cpil","text":"Here I describe two methods for barcoding microalgae. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2ar60","text":"One starts with extracted DNA. In that case, I use Promega GoTaq, and so far, it has performed well. If I am only barcoding, I prefer using Phire Direct PCR. as it doesn't require DNA extraction.  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5vci6","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bv2a8","text":"Both methods offer the possibility of using master mixes that include loading dye, which saves time and does not affect Sanger sequencing. Additionally, I use ExoSAP-IT as a cleaning method instead of a column-based kit. I am happy with the results, as I have successfully obtained sequences of nearly 1kb.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

status.info: We use this protocol and it's working

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"73eg1","text":"PCR 18S/ITS","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":11}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"daiuu","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2kmbr","text":"Use 1 ul of the extracted DNA. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9dqk8","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"66brn","text":"  PCR1XGoTaq® Green Master Mix (M712)10 ulPrimer F 10 uM0.4 ulPrimer R 10 uM0.4 ulDMSO1 ulWater 7.2 ulDNA1 ulTotal 20 ul","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":120}],"data":{}},{"key":"bd66o","text":"Run the PCR program (I use a touchdown PCR, starting at 63 C as annelaing temperature and reducing 0.5 C each cycle for 12 cycles. Then 25 cycles at 55 C)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5apt2","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"873ph","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ati36","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6mic8","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ari3","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e2odl","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"tables","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"cellsMeta":{"0_0":"","0_1":"","1_0":"","1_1":"","2_0":"","2_1":"","3_0":"","3_1":"","4_0":"","4_1":"","5_0":"","5_1":"","6_0":"","6_1":"","7_0":"","7_1":""},"colTitles":["PCR reagent","1x reaction\n","___x reactions"],"colWidths":[100,100,100],"data":[["GoTaq® Green Master Mix (M712)","10 ul",""],["Primer F 10 uM","0.4 ul",""],["Primer R 10 uM","0.4 ul",""],["DMSO","1 ul",""],["Water ","7.2 ul",""],["DNA","1 ul",""],["Total ","20 ul",""]],"guid":"4FEED3D3274711EE86FC0A58A9FEAC02","isJexcelDataFormat":true,"legend":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"5g3ri","text":"Remember to add one negative reaction and one \"for the pipette\" (extra volume to compensate for pipetting error)","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}},"mergeCells":{},"printData":[["GoTaq® Green Master Mix (M712)","10 ul",""],["Primer F 10 uM","0.4 ul",""],["Primer R 10 uM","0.4 ul",""],["DMSO","1 ul",""],["Water ","7.2 ul",""],["DNA","1 ul",""],["Total ","20 ul",""]],"rowHeights":[23,23,23,23,23,23,23]}}}}

steps.section: Direct PCR using phire taq. No DNA extraction
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"cduqq","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ou62","text":"https://www.thermofisher.com/order/catalog/product/F160S","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":56}],"data":{}},{"key":"1s034","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8jtn5","text":"Use the Dilution \u0026 Storage protocol as follows:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dd1od","text":"Take a colony or an aliquot of culture (enough to see a small pellet in the tube) and place it in 20 μL of Dilution Buffer (use PCR tubes). You can crush the sample with a pipette tip by briefly pressing it against the tube wall.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8chah","text":"Heat the sample to 95°C for 2 minutes and then store it at 4°C overnight before proceeding with PCR. Before usage, you can crush the sample with a pipette tip again. This step aids in breaking the cells.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"agh3b","text":"If a larger amount of sample is used, increase the volume of Dilution Buffer to 50 μL. The solution should appear greenish.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3290k","text":"Spin down the plant material, and use 0.5-1 μL of the supernatant as a template in a 20 μL PCR reaction. The required volume of the supernatant may vary depending on the plant material used and the volume used for the dilution.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b0vcv","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7a8o9","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"2s2m5","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"f8cvr","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":2,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"CC9DDDF2274811EE867F0A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://www.thermofisher.com/order/catalog/product/F160S"}},"1":{"type":"image","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"7B738929274A11EE867F0A58A9FEAC02","height":479.8080614203455,"id":"7B70D780274A11EEBEBD2F6D8A1184FE","is_video":false,"legend":"{\"blocks\":[{\"key\":\"br5qn\",\"text\":\"Volumes\",\"type\":\"unstyled\",\"depth\":0,\"inlineStyleRanges\":[],\"entityRanges\":[],\"data\":{}}],\"entityMap\":{}}","mime":null,"nestedSelector":null,"original_name":null,"placeholder":"https://lh5.googleusercontent.com/KzvBhYhaVZAr3IzriHPmg4nwXg9ao0IqwzJTF40fqz8nsueRVHPwLJC8WOAUH3cdU4jCIqhUQwa3Tuur7Z2rMuNUfb4U6B_wq5uoknFqc6BHnrh4rF9gVFEY9ivNvvpFILtn8cANCwBKB5Mm2VR7Zw","shadow":false,"source":"https://lh5.googleusercontent.com/KzvBhYhaVZAr3IzriHPmg4nwXg9ao0IqwzJTF40fqz8nsueRVHPwLJC8WOAUH3cdU4jCIqhUQwa3Tuur7Z2rMuNUfb4U6B_wq5uoknFqc6BHnrh4rF9gVFEY9ivNvvpFILtn8cANCwBKB5Mm2VR7Zw","width":580}},"2":{"type":"image","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"CCE9E78D274A11EE867F0A58A9FEAC02","height":"401","id":"CCE72E70274A11EEBEBD2F6D8A1184FE","is_video":false,"legend":"{\"blocks\":[{\"key\":\"75s2t\",\"text\":\"Thermocycler program. \",\"type\":\"unstyled\",\"depth\":0,\"inlineStyleRanges\":[],\"entityRanges\":[],\"data\":{}}],\"entityMap\":{}}","mime":null,"nestedSelector":null,"original_name":null,"placeholder":"https://lh6.googleusercontent.com/-Lj63bfqy40lmwWMUWWx5HvGUm_-neDI291sO7wHcGQ1tE6InMj_v3kkYpOe_vk5xZ-RSKwwQx-iBH8diP9K2ZqUibOpaFFhkz5VOBJUzmFDBWLW3blx3-GQY0lOZFUVNdGQevRU6GP5PRH4rs0pDg","shadow":false,"source":"https://lh6.googleusercontent.com/-Lj63bfqy40lmwWMUWWx5HvGUm_-neDI291sO7wHcGQ1tE6InMj_v3kkYpOe_vk5xZ-RSKwwQx-iBH8diP9K2ZqUibOpaFFhkz5VOBJUzmFDBWLW3blx3-GQY0lOZFUVNdGQevRU6GP5PRH4rs0pDg","width":"466"}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"dknrh","text":"I run 7 μl of the amplification reaction on 1.5% agarose gels to check for amplification and size. Since GoTaq already contains loading dyes, I only need to mix my sample with 2 μl of 1:1000 SyBr Safe dye. Then, I load the mixture onto the gel.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4p6ro","text":"ExoSAP-IT:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5ftea","text":"To use ExoSAP-IT, follow these steps:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6s0e5","text":"Dilute the ExoSAP-IT enzyme in molecular-grade H2O at a ratio of 1:4 (0.25 μl enzyme in 0.75 μl water).","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cjoj7","text":"Add 1 μl of the diluted ExoSAP-IT mix to 1-2 μl of your PCR product. (For my application, I use 2 μl of the PCR product and 1 μl of the diluted enzyme mix, and it works well for me).","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bgocc","text":"Place 1 μl of the mixture at the side of each well on a sequencing plate, then add your PCR reaction and mix by pipetting. Briefly spin down the plate to ensure all wells are properly filled. Since the PCR product is green, visual inspection is quick.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8jsd7","text":"Seal the plate and run the enzyme protocol in the thermocycler. Due to the enzyme dilution, I use slightly longer times: 30 minutes at 37°C, followed by 15 minutes at 80°C, and then hold at 4°C.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"dvq90","text":"Add the appropriate sequencing reaction mix to each well. I use the BPC reaction mix, but with a 10 μM primer instead of 15 μM (as I don't keep a separate stock for sequencing). Additionally, I assume there might be some evaporation of my template after the ExoSAP-IT reaction. Instead of counting it as 3 μl (1 μl ExoSAP-IT + 2 μl reaction), I consider the template volume as 2 μl.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cslri","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4619n","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a460m","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c1qt5","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9nkpv","text":"  Sequencing PCRX1BDT0.5 ul5X buffer0.4 ulPrimer 10 uM0.4 ulDMSO0.1 ulH2O2 ulTemplate2 ul (already in well)","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":107}],"data":{}},{"key":"2iblk","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cfq72","text":" {"blocks":[{"key":"86icb","text":" Primers for sequencing the 18S barcoding region (primer pairs SSU1/C18G; or N18J/C18J)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c5fp3","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4mq9o","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"931g6","text":" SSU1-F TGGTTGATCCTGCCAGTAG SSU2-R TGATCCTTCCGCAGGTTCAC ITS2-R CATTTCGCTGCGTTCTTCATC N18G-F AGGGCAAGTCTGGTGCCAG C18G-R TGGCACCAGACTTGCCCT N18J-F CAATAACAGGTCTGTGATGCCCTTA C18J-R TCTAAGGGCATCACAGACCTGTTATTG M379F GGTTTCAAAGCTCTTCGTGC M633F CATGCGTTGGAGAGACCGT M650R CGGTCTCTCCAACGCATGA M1161R CATGTGCCATACGTGAATAC ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":394}],"data":{}},{"key":"eshts","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7vu34","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"atedo","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"tables","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"cellsMeta":{"0_0":"","0_1":"","10_0":"","10_1":"","1_0":"","1_1":"","2_0":"","2_1":"","3_0":"","3_1":"","4_0":"","4_1":"","5_0":"","5_1":"","6_0":"","6_1":"","7_0":"","7_1":"","8_0":"","8_1":"","9_0":"","9_1":""},"colTitles":["",""],"colWidths":[100,"422"],"data":[["SSU1-F","TGGTTGATCCTGCCAGTAG"],["C18G-R","TGGCACCAGACTTGCCCT"],["N18J-F","CAATAACAGGTCTGTGATGCCCTTA"],["C18J-R","TCTAAGGGCATCACAGACCTGTTATTG"]],"guid":"34BD96E9274D11EE867F0A58A9FEAC02","isJexcelDataFormat":true,"legend":"","mergeCells":{},"printData":[["SSU1-F","TGGTTGATCCTGCCAGTAG"],["C18G-R","TGGCACCAGACTTGCCCT"],["N18J-F","CAATAACAGGTCTGTGATGCCCTTA"],["C18J-R","TCTAAGGGCATCACAGACCTGTTATTG"]],"rowHeights":[23,23,23,23]}}}}

title: Barcoding protocol for microalgae
